Body.Description: Expect Prompt models a single expect and answer prompt of the interactive command.
Body.Label: Expect Prompt
Body.Name: ExpectPrompt

TypeDefinition.Description: The regular expression of the expect prompt of the Interactive command. You must provide the complete regular expression of the expect string and the expression must end with special character '$' to match the end of the Expect string.
TypeDefinition.Label: Expect
TypeDefinition.Name: Expect

TypeDefinition.Description: The answer string to the Expect prompt.
TypeDefinition.Label: Send
TypeDefinition.Name: Send

Body.Description: SSH command to execute on the remote server. SSH task executor supports executing non-interactive and prompts based interactive commands.
Body.Label: SSH Command Type
Body.Name: SshCommandType

TypeDefinition.Description: The SSH commands that are to be run on the remote server. Multiple commands can be configured to be run on the given target by chaining the commands with special characters - '&&'  ';' '|' etc. Note that command chaining is allowed only when the command type is Non-Interactive.
TypeDefinition.Label: Command
TypeDefinition.Name: Command

TypeDefinition.Description: The SSH command type to be run on the remote server. The SSH task supports running Non-Interactive and expect prompts based Interactive commands.
TypeDefinition.Label: Command Type
TypeDefinition.Name: CommandType

TypeDefinition.Description: Expect prompts required as part of command execution. It is a collection of ExpectPrompt type.
TypeDefinition.Label: Expect Prompts
TypeDefinition.Name: ExpectPrompts

TypeDefinition.Description: The regular expression of the Shell Prompt of the remote server or target. You must provide the complete regular expression of the Shell Prompt and it must end with special character '$' to match the end of the Shell Prompt string.
TypeDefinition.Label: Shell Prompt
TypeDefinition.Name: ShellPrompt

Body.Description: The types of values that can be extracted from API responses in IO Generic API tasks.
Body.Label: Response Parameter Type
Body.Name: ResponseParameterTypeEnum

TypeDefinition.Description: The types of values that can be extracted from API responses in IO Generic API tasks. The JSON type can be used to extract any type of value from response as a parameter.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameter Type
TypeDefinition.Name: ParameterType

Body.Description: This data type takes information about a parameter that needs to be extracted from an API response in Generic API tasks.
Body.Label: Response Parameter
Body.Name: TextResponseParameter

TypeDefinition.Description: The regular expression of the line in the command response where the interested capture value resides. The format to specify the capture value in this input is '$<Name of the parameter>'. For example, if we need to capture 'intersight' in the sample response 'intersight@cisco.com', the regular expression must be $<Name>\@cisco\.com where 'Name' is the name given to the captured parameter.
TypeDefinition.Label: Regular Expression
TypeDefinition.Name: RegexLine

TypeDefinition.Description: Name of the output under which the captured value is saved. This is the same name that needs to be given in the capture group in the Regular Expression field. For example, if the value of the Regular Expression field is $<ParameterName>\@cisco\.com, then the Name field must be given the value - ParameterName.
TypeDefinition.Label: Name
TypeDefinition.Name: Name

TypeDefinition.Description: The response parameter type - String, Integer, Float, Boolean. The default value is String.
TypeDefinition.Label: Type
TypeDefinition.Name: Type

Body.Description:
Response parser framework supports extraction of required values from API/device responses. These responses may be of various content types such as XML, JSON, etc. The values of importance are modeled as parameters in the response parser framework.
The parameters can be of a scalar value type or a collection of values. A group of related parameters can be modeled as a single complex type parameter. These complex types will be very useful to extract a set of repeating group of related parameters.
A response parser specification defines the set of parameters that need to be extracted from the content. The response parser specification allows complex type definitions to be defined for any complex parameters.
Body.Label: Response Parser
Body.Name: TextResponseParserType

TypeDefinition.Description: The collection of parameters that need to be extracted from the API response.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameters
TypeDefinition.Name: Parameters

Body.Description: Executes SSH commands against the given endpoint. This task can be executed on targets added as SSH Endpoint or Ansible Endpoint in Intersight.
Body.Label: Invoke SSH Commands
Body.Name: InvokeSshCommands

InputDefinition.Description: The external target on which the SSH commands are run. The SSH commands can be run only on targets added as SSH Endpoint or Ansible Endpoint target in Intersight and are in the connected state.
InputDefinition.Label: External Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=((TargetType eq SSHEndpoint or TargetType eq AnsibleEndpoint) and Status eq Connected)

InputDefinition.Description: The SSH commands that are run on the remote server along with the details of the SSH command.
InputDefinition.Label: SSH Command
InputDefinition.Name: SshCommand

InputDefinition.Description: The command timeout in seconds for the execution of the command against the given endpoint. The default command timeout is 600 seconds. Range is from 10 to 7200 seconds.
InputDefinition.Label: Command Timeout
InputDefinition.Name: Timeout

InputDefinition.Description: The list of expected command exit codes of the execution of the command against the given endpoint. Default exit code of 0 is used to determine the status of command execution when this input is not provided.
InputDefinition.Label: Expected Exit Codes
InputDefinition.Name: ExpectedExitCodes

InputDefinition.Description: Set this value to True if the entire command response needs to be displayed as part of the task output. Default value is false.
InputDefinition.Label: Show Command Output
InputDefinition.Name: ShowCommandOutput

InputDefinition.Description: The structure of the response parser which provides the list of values that need to be extracted from the response.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Parser
InputDefinition.Name: ResponseParser

OutputDefinition.Description: The exit code after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Exit Code
OutputDefinition.Name: ExitCode

OutputDefinition.Description: The complete response after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Command Output
OutputDefinition.Name: CommandOutput

OutputDefinition.Description: Captures the error encountered while executing the command.
OutputDefinition.Label: Command Execution Error
OutputDefinition.Name: CommandExecutionError

OutputDefinition.Description: The extracted parameters after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Extracted Parameters
OutputDefinition.Name: ExtractedParameters

Body.Description: Deploys Kubeflow on Cisco Intersight Kubernetes Service clusters. You will need to create an SSH target for these clusters.

InputDefinition.Description: The IKS cluster on which Kubeflow will be deployed. This is using an SSH connection to a controlplane node.
InputDefinition.Label: IKS Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=(TargetType eq SSHEndpoint and Status eq Connected)

InputDefinition.Description: The version of Kubeflow that should be deployed
InputDefinition.Label: Kubeflow Version
InputDefinition.Name: kfversion

InputDefinition.Description: Determines if a proxy should be used for file downloads to the IKS controlplane node
InputDefinition.Label: Use proxy for file downloads
InputDefinition.Name: use_proxy

InputDefinition.Description: The URL of the proxy that should be used for file downloads. The format is http(s)://URL:PORT
InputDefinition.Label: Proxy URL
InputDefinition.Name: proxy_url

Body.Label: Deploy Kubeflow on IKS
Body.Name: DeployKubeflowonIKS

Tasks.Description: Downloads all files required for Kubeflow

SshCommand.Command: {{if eq .global.workflow.input.use_proxy true}}git config --global http.proxy {{.global.workflow.input.proxy_url}} && git clone https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests.git && cd manifests && git checkout v{{.global.workflow.input.kfversion}}-branch{{else}}git clone https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests.git && cd manifests && git checkout v{{.global.workflow.input.kfversion}}-branch{{end}}

Tasks.Label: Download Kubeflow files
Tasks.Name: InvokeSshCommands1

SshCommand.Command: {{if eq .global.workflow.input.use_proxy true}}curl -L https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/releases/download/v3.2.0/kustomize_3.2.0_linux_amd64 --proxy {{.global.workflow.input.proxy_url}} --output kustomize && chmod +x kustomize{{else}}curl -L https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/releases/download/v3.2.0/kustomize_3.2.0_linux_amd64 --output kustomize && chmod +x kustomize{{end}}

Tasks.Description: Deploys Kubeflow on the target cluster using Kustomize to build the yaml files

SshCommand.Command: for i in {1..5}; do ./kustomize build ./manifests/example | kubectl apply -f -;sleep 60; done

Tasks.Label: Deploy Kubeflow using Kustomize
Tasks.Name: InvokeSshCommands3
